title: 'Why are you so afraid?' SC rejects privacy plea, allows ED to access I-PAC man‚Äôs phone
content: The Supreme Court has refused to stop the ED from accessing data from an I-PAC functionary's seized mobile phone. The court questioned the plea to protect privacy, stating it knows how to safeguard innocent citizens. This comes as the ED faces challenges accessing digital devices in other money laundering cases.

title: Speeding car crushes 5-year-old to death in Pune; CCTV video emerges
content: Tragedy struck Joy Nest Society as five-year-old Nikash Reddy was fatally struck by a speeding car while playing. New CCTV footage reveals the horrifying moments leading up to the accident. The driver, who had entered the society to drop off a friend, immediately rushed the boy to the hospital, but he was pronounced dead on arrival.

title: T20 WC drama: 'If Bangladesh don't play, it won't matter; if Pakistan refuse ... '
content: Former Pakistan spinner Danish Kaneria backed the ICC's decision to maintain the 2026 T20 World Cup schedule in India, dismissing Bangladesh's security concerns. He stated Bangladesh's absence would have minimal impact, highlighting that political issues are overshadowing cricket discussions and urging for the sport to remain separate from politics.

title: Amazon preparing for another round of layoffs, thousands of jobs under scanner
content: Amazon is planning to cut approximately 14,000 corporate jobs starting next week, marking the second major layoff wave since October and bringing total reductions to 30,000 roles. CEO Andy Jassy clarified the cuts aren't driven by AI or financial concerns but by excessive bureaucracy and organizational layers. The layoffs will affect employees across AWS, retail, Prime Video, and human resources divisions, representing nearly 10% of Amazon's corporate workforce.

title: OpenAI's Bret Taylor seems to have 'forgotten' the company whose board he is heading
content: OpenAI board chairman Bret Taylor has declared AI is "probably" a bubble, expecting market correction and consolidation in coming years. Speaking at Davos, Taylor‚Äîwho also founded $10 billion AI startup Sierra‚Äîcompared the current landscape to the 1999 dot-com bubble. Despite calling himself an AI optimist, he believes both "smart" and "dumb money" are flooding the sector, though he expects the free market to eventually determine real winners.

title: 'Museum of failures': Harvard MBA and ex-JP Morgan analyst shares hard career lessons
content: Grace Lee, a Harvard Business School graduate, shared her "museum of failures" on Instagram, detailing career struggles, a late ADHD diagnosis, and the toll of hustle culture. Her candid reflection on setbacks and health challenges offers a relatable perspective for young professionals, emphasizing that ambition doesn't always guarantee success and highlighting the importance of well-being.

title: Sam Altman is not happy with what everyone thinks of OpenAI and ChatGPT
content: OpenAI's API business has achieved over $1 billion in annual recurring revenue in the past month, signaling strong developer and enterprise adoption. This growth occurs as investors express concerns about the AI company's long-term financial sustainability and face increasing competition from rivals like Google's Gemini, which has seen significant user growth.

title: Clash breaks out near MP's Ujjain: 11 buses vandalised, shops damaged
content: A clash erupted in Tarana town, Ujjain, leaving six injured after a dispute led to vandalism of buses and shops. Eyewitnesses reported a group beat up two individuals, one linked to a Hindu outfit, over a petty disagreement. Police have booked six people for attempted murder, and the situation is now under control.

title: Paytm shares fall 10%! Here's why One97 Communications stock is trading in red
content: Paytm shares tumbled nearly 10% amid speculation about the future of the Payment Infrastructure Development Fund (PIDF) scheme, which reportedly contributes significantly to its operating profit. The company clarified its recognition of PIDF incentives and its strategy to offset potential impacts. Meanwhile, Investec initiated coverage with a 'Buy' rating, citing strong fundamentals.

title: 22 more fall ill after drinking water in Indore, develop jaundice symptoms
content: At least two dozen Mhow residents, primarily children, have fallen ill with jaundice after allegedly consuming contaminated water. Indore Collector Shivam Verma visited the affected areas, directing immediate water quality checks and sanitation improvements. Health teams are conducting door-to-door surveys, ensuring timely treatment for all, with no critical cases reported.

title: 'Once-in-a-generation opportunity for companies like Siemens, Mercedes', Nvidia CEO tells Europe
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang sees AI robotics as a massive opportunity for Europe, leveraging its strong manufacturing base to lead in physical AI.  Major European firms and tech giants are investing heavily in robotics, signaling a significant shift.  Huang emphasizes the need for increased energy supply to support this AI infrastructure boom, calling it the largest buildout in history.

title: In 4 or 40 days: Location decides how fast your passport arrives; Kerala remains fastest
content: Passport issuance times in India vary significantly by region, with some areas like Goa and Kerala averaging just four to five working days, while others, such as Chhattisgarh's Raipur, can take up to 40 days. Even within states, disparities exist, with delays also noted in the crucial police verification stage, impacting overall applicant experience.

title: 'To expand like Gujarat': PM Modi's big prediction on BJP's rise in Kerala
content: Addressing a large BJP rally at the Putharikandam Maidan, PM Modi said the party‚Äôs rise in Kerala would mirror its early growth in Gujarat, where it began by winning control of a single city nearly four decades ago. He recalled that before 1987, the BJP was a marginal force in Gujarat and received little attention.

title: Rupee tumbles to new low! Currency falls to 91.99 against US dollar
content: The Indian Rupee strengthened today against the US Dollar. This rise follows a softening of tariff threats between the US and Europe. Traders noted improved investor sentiment. However, the Rupee still faces pressure from foreign fund outflows. Experts suggest a period of consolidation and possible recovery. The 92.00 level is a key resistance point.

title: ‚ÄòGoing against assumptions‚Äô: Jasprit Bumrah celebrates 10 years as India‚Äôs pace phenomenon
content: Jasprit Bumrah celebrated a decade in international cricket, a journey marked by overcoming doubts and achieving remarkable success.  Since his 2016 debut, Bumrah has become India's premier fast bowler, amassing 486 wickets across formats. His exceptional Test record, particularly overseas, and Player of the Tournament award at the 2024 T20 World Cup highlight his enduring impact.

title: Tharoor not 'relevant'? Congress neta's big attack as Kerala MP skips key poll meet
content: Tharoor, ‚Äã‚Äã‚Äãwho is reportedly unhappy after Rahul Gandhi did not meet him during his visit to Kochi, will instead attend the Kerala literature festival.  The controversy around Tharoor and his reported rift with the party erupted following a series of events that led to the experts connecting dots of the veteran leader's dissatisfaction with his current position in the grand old party.

title: Nifty50 goes below 25,100; BSE Sensex drops over 700 points - top reasons
content: Stock market crash today: The Sensex began the session on a positive note, but dropped over 700 points in afternoon trade. At 2:19 PM, Nifty50 was trading at 25,064.55, down 225 points or 0.89%. BSE Sensex was at 81,549.19, down 758 points or 0.92%.

title: 'It is tough on the body': Chris Morris on injuries in South Africa's T20 World Cup camp
content: Chris Morris views SA20 as an ideal T20 World Cup build-up, praising competitive conditions and the rise of South African players. He lauded Kagiso Rabada‚Äôs return, highlighted the rise of Jordan Hermann and Nqobani Mokoena, and stressed the value of spinners alongside seamers. Morris also acknowledges injury challenges, SA20‚Äôs transformative impact, and the enduring importance of all-rounders in modern international cricket.

title: Complaint filed against Palaash over Rs 40 lakh cheating case
content: A 34-year-old actor and producer has approached the police in Maharashtra‚Äôs Sangli district, alleging that he was cheated of Rs 40 lakh by composer and filmmaker Palaash Muchhal. Police confirmed on Thursday that no First Information Report (FIR) has been registered so far in the matter.

title: Manipur: Meitei man visiting Kuki fianc√©e abducted, shot dead; attack caught on cam
content: A Meitei man visiting his Kuki fianc√©e in Churachandpur was abducted and shot dead on camera, sparking outrage and fresh tensions in Manipur. The victim, M Rishikanta, was found dead near Natjang village. The perpetrators' video message read "No Peace, No Popular Government." The case is now being handed over to the NIA for investigation.

title: 'Minor incident': Massive outrage after Karnataka MP downplays tourist rape-murder
content: Koppal MP K Rajashekhar Hitnal's description of a foreign tourist's rape and murder as a "minor incident" has ignited widespread outrage. Political leaders and the public condemned the remarks, deeming them irresponsible and a downplaying of a serious law and order issue that has impacted tourism. Despite a clarification, criticism persists, with demands for a full apology.

title: Exclusive | BCB writes another letter to ICC; seeks intervention of DRC
content: Bangladesh Cricket Board has again written to the ICC seeking arbitration through its independent dispute resolution committee after the world body refused to shift their T20 World Cup matches from India. Citing security concerns, the BCB has maintained it will not travel unless matches are moved to Sri Lanka. The standoff, however, was triggered by Mustafizur Rahman‚Äôs removal from the IPL over security issues.

title: PM Modi says Tamil Nadu ready to bid farewell to ‚Äòcorrupt‚Äô DMK; Stalin hits back
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi launched the NDA's campaign in Tamil Nadu, asserting voters are ready to oust the "corrupt" DMK government. Chief Minister M.K. Stalin countered, accusing the NDA of betraying the state and highlighting pending demands, including financial aid and NEET exemption.

title: Stock market today: Top gainers and losers on Nifty50 and Sensex; check list
content: Indian stock markets opened flat on Friday, with both Nifty50 and Sensex eventually slipping into the red by afternoon trade. Foreign investors continued their selling spree, while domestic institutions provided support. Key gainers included Dr. Reddy's and Asian Paints, while Adani Enterprises and Eternal were among the top losers. Asian markets, however, showed positive momentum.

title: ‚ÄòEntirely my fault‚Äô: Abhimanyu Easwaran owns freak run-out that stunned Ranji match
content: Bengal captain Abhimanyu Easwaran accepted full blame for a shocking run-out during a Ranji Trophy match. Batting on 81, Easwaran walked out of his crease assuming a drinks break, only for the bowler to deflect a return shot onto the stumps. He called it his own mistake, ending a promising innings.

title: Noida techie death: Delivery exec who tried to rescue Yuvraj alleges police pressure
content: A delivery executive, the key eyewitness in software engineer Yuvraj Mehta's death, alleged police pressured him to give statements supporting their version. Moninder Singh claimed he was forced to record a video with a dictated script after being summoned to the police station. He stated he was scared at the time but later decided to stand by the truth.

title: Micron's Gujarat plant begins next month, India making 'most complex' chips says Vaishnaw
content: Micron Technology's $2.75 billion semiconductor facility in Sanand, Gujarat, is set to begin commercial production by the end of February, with pilot production already underway. India is increasingly seen as a hub for advanced chip design and manufacturing, including complex two-nanometre nodes, supported by strategic global partnerships.

title: Jennifer Lopez in talks to lend voice to song in Vikrant Massey starrer 'White'
content: International thriller 'White', starring Vikrant Massey, is generating buzz with rumors of Jennifer Lopez joining for a special song. The track, in English and Spanish, aims to promote Indian philosophies for world peace, inspired by anthems like 'Heal The World'.

title: 'Used as bait': ICE detains 5-year-old Liam Conejo Ramos in Minneapolis - 10 things to know
content: A five-year-old boy's detention by US immigration agents in Minneapolis has sparked outrage in the United States. Liam Conejo Ramos was taken with his father from their home, with officials disputing accounts of the father fleeing and offers to care for the child being refused. The incident intensifies scrutiny of the Trump administration's immigration enforcement.

title: Posts against BJP leaders: UK-based YouTuber Dr Sangram Patil stopped at Mumbai airport
content: Dr. Sangram Patil, a UK-based medical professional and popular YouTube creator, has taken legal action in the Bombay High Court to contest an FIR and a lookout circular issued by the Mumbai police. The allegations are linked to his Facebook posts that reportedly criticize BJP leaders.

title: Relief for commuters: Bike taxi ban revoked by Karnataka HC; state asked to impose conditions
content: Bike taxis are now permitted to operate in Karnataka following a high court ruling that overturned a previous single-bench order. A division bench directed the state government to consider applications for vehicle registration as transport vehicles and grant permits. This decision allows aggregators to apply for licenses, paving the way for wider bike taxi services across the state.

title: Doctors found a way to replace 79-year-old man's heart valve without harming his kidneys
content: A 79-year-old man with severe aortic valve narrowing and chronic kidney disease underwent a rare, completely contrast-free, ultrasound-guided Transcatheter Aortic Valve Replacement (TAVR). This innovative approach, utilizing Aortic Valve Ultrasound (AVUS), ensured precise valve sizing and safe implantation, avoiding further kidney damage and the need for dialysis. The patient recovered quickly and was discharged within 24 hours.

title: Chhattisgarh: Monkey snatches 20-day-old from mother's lap, throws her into well
content: A 20-day-old infant miraculously survived after a monkey snatched her from her mother's arms and threw her into an open well in Chhattisgarh.  A quick-thinking nurse administered CPR, reviving the baby who was later found to be stable. The father attributes her survival to the nurse's presence and the diaper she wore.

title: Mumbai BMC mayor election: Meet the women frontrunners for the richest civic body
content: The BJP is set to claim the Mumbai mayor's post after nearly four decades, with several women corporators in contention. This comes as the mayoral seat was reserved for a woman from the open category. The draw of lots also determined reservations for women across Maharashtra's municipal corporations, sparking some objections from the Shiv Sena (UBT).

title: Board of Peace: Trump calls Putin‚Äôs idea of using frozen Russian assets ‚Äòinteresting‚Äô
content: US President Trump reacted positively to Russian President Putin's offer to contribute $1 billion to his proposed "Board of Peace," suggesting he would accept if the funds were Putin's own. Putin indicated frozen Russian assets could be used for this, and later to rebuild Ukraine. Trump signed the charter for the body, which aims to oversee peace efforts globally.

title: Congress MP‚Äôs nephew ‚Äòaccidentally‚Äô shoots wife, ends his life in Ahmedabad
content: A shocking incident at a Bodakdev highrise saw Congress MP Shaktisinh Gohil's nephew, Yashrajsinh Gohil, allegedly shoot his wife Rajeshwari dead before taking his own life. Police are investigating the tragedy, which occurred late Wednesday night, with initial reports suggesting an accidental discharge followed by suicide. Both victims were declared dead at the scene.

title: Board of Peace: Trump withdraws invite to Carney after 'Canada doesn't live because of US' remark
content: US President Trump withdrew Canada's invitation to his Board of Peace after Prime Minister Carney challenged Trump's assertion of Canadian dependence. Carney, speaking at the World Economic Forum, had said that Canada thrives independently, not solely due to the US, advocating for it as a model in an era of democratic decline.

title: Gurgaon kidnapping: Man thrashed with sticks, bundled into car in bid to recover Rs 6.5 lakh
content: Two men were arrested in Gurgaon for kidnapping and assaulting a delivery partner over a Rs 6.5 lakh financial dispute. The accused, Jaybir and Aman, admitted to the planned attempt to recover the money, claiming the victim had stolen it two years prior. The assault, which involved kicks, punches, and wooden sticks, was foiled by an emergency response vehicle.

title: T20 World Cup: Replacement call looms as ICC deadline ends with Bangladesh defiant
content: Bangladesh's Cricket Board has missed the ICC's deadline, leading to their likely exclusion from the T20 World Cup. Despite internal talks, no official communication was sent to the ICC, paving the way for Scotland to replace them. The government cited security concerns and political reasons for the decision, deeming India unsafe for players.

title: Ravens hiring Bolts' Minter as new head coach
content: The Ravens are hiring Los Angeles Chargers defensive coordinator Jesse Minter as their next head coach, the team announced Thursday.

title: LeBron brushes off Buss report: 'Don't really care'
content: LeBron James said he wasn't bothered by an ESPN story this week that detailed his allegedly strained relationship with Lakers team governor Jeanie Buss, saying, "I don't care about how somebody feels about me."

title: Colts confirm FBI opened probe into Irsay's death
content: The Indianapolis Colts on Thursday acknowledged the existence of an FBI investigation into the death of owner Jim Irsay and the potential involvement of a California doctor who reportedly prescribed him pain pills and ketamine.

title: Kuminga injures knee, ankle; holding off on MRI
content: The Warriors' Jonathan Kuminga told ESPN he will wait to see how his hyperextended knee feels Friday morning before deciding whether to get an MRI.

title: Golden on Bediako return: 'We'll beat 'em anyways'
content: Florida coach Todd Golden said Thursday that he doesn't agree that Charles Bediako should be able to play for Alabama but doesn't think it will matter if he does when the teams play Feb. 1.

title: 'We're back': No. 16 Sooners stun Gamecocks
content: Aaliyah Chavez scored 15 of her 26 points in overtime, and No. 16 Oklahoma stunned No. 2 South Carolina 94-82 on Thursday night.

title: Alcaraz stays sharp, sweeps past game Moutet
content: Corentin Moutet kept Carlos Alcaraz on his toes with a variety of shots, but the 22-year-old cruised to a 6-2, 6-4, 6-1 win in their third-round Australian Open match.

title: Rodman contract saga ends with record Spirit deal
content: United States forward Trinity Rodman signed a record three-year contract with the Washington Spirit on Thursday to remain at the club, ending months-long uncertainty over the star's future.

title: üèÄ Who is NBA's No. 1 rookie?
content: With the NBA now at the midpoint of its season, ESPN analyst Zach Kram ranks the top 10 rookies based on their performance.

title: Australian Open live: De Minaur battling Tiafoe, extreme heat forces schedule changes
content: Third round singles action begins at the Australian Open on Friday with world No. 1s Carlos Alcaraz and Aryna Sabalenka, as well as American star Coco Gauff, highlighting the day session.

title: Who were the most valuable players in the NFL this season? Let's stack the top 100
content: We took the MVP conversation beyond Drake Maye vs. Matthew Stafford ... way beyond. Here are the 100 top players of the 2025 season.

title: USWNT star Trinity Rodman's record deal: Why it's a boon for her, but NWSL worries linger
content: Trinity Rodman will stay in the U.S. and play for the NWSL. Even as she rejected offers from England, it exposes the NWSL's problems retaining stars.

title: Who wins the 2026 national title? We predict the CFP bracket
content: It's never too early to look ahead to next season. Some teams look like easy playoff picks, but who rounds out the field?

title: Wetzel: G League to the SEC? What are we doing here?
content: Wetzel: The NCAA needs Congress to give it a skinny exemption to at least set some eligibility standards.

title: 8 years, 5 schools and a career-threatening condition: The story of Tyon Grant-Foster
content: From heart troubles to an eligibility battle, here's how the Gonzaga forward kept his playing career alive.

title: Welcoming the HOF Class of 2026: Why Carlos Beltran and Andruw Jones got in
content: Cooperstown welcomed two new players Tuesday night. Here's why the center fielders are headed to the Hall.

title: How Cooper Kupp mentored and Davante Adams elevated Puka Nacua's game
content: Puka Nacua's elite performance can be attributed to the mentorship of veteran receivers Cooper Kupp and Davante Adams.

title: 'You should've never been born': How Buss family infighting drove the $10B sale of the Lakers
content: The post-Jerry Buss era was defined by resentment, dysfunction and conflict -- and ended with the loss of the most valuable family-owned franchise in the world.

title: What NBA greats Kerr, Nash & Co. learned owning LaLiga's Mallorca
content: Steve Kerr and Steve Nash own Mallorca with a former USMNT international and an ex-tennis pro. What has it taught them about sport, leadership and life?

title: Inside the rise of Vanderbilt's Mikayla Blakes
content: From underrated to perhaps the best hoops player in the country, Mikayla Blakes is just getting started.

title: Why Frank Nazar is the Blackhawks' perfect complement to Connor Bedard
content: The 22-year-old center is slated to make his return Thursday to a team still fighting to get in the playoff mix.

title: Ranking the top 50 players in the Olympics: Why MacKinnon is No. 1
content: As 12 teams face off for gold in Milan Cortina, here are the players who will have the biggest impact.

title: Power Rankings: Miami (Ohio) debuts, Nebraska rises
content: The RedHawks crack the top 25 and the Cornhuskers climb as two of the last three unbeaten teams standing.

title: Champions League: Arsenal still perfect; top-8 fight getting messy
content: Arsenal are still top of the Champions League table, and likely to remain there, but the fight for a bye to the round of 16 is shaping up to be fierce.

title: Kyren Williams among conference championship top 30 predicted anytime TD scorers
content: Kyren Williams, Courtland Sutton and Stefon Diggs are among top predictions for anytime TD scorers on NFL conference championship weekend.

title: Google updates Curt Cignetti search page to reflect iconic quote
content: Indiana's national champion head coach also had his signature Chipotle order added to the restaurant's app, adding to a big week on and off the field.

title: Liberty, Fever among the top 2026 WNBA schedule reveals on social media
content: The 2026 WNBA schedule is out and teams announced their calendar in their own creative ways on social media.

title: Power Rankings: Iowa, Ohio State soar into top 10 -- but can they stay there?
content: The Big Ten and Big 12 are winners as Ohio State, Iowa and Baylor crack the top 10. UConn stays No. 1.

title: Bracketology: Big nonconference win boosts Ohio State to a 3-seed
content: Results Sunday and Monday shook up the top 16, and the Buckeyes benefited the most, climbing two seed lines.

title: Don't be surprised if ... Cooper Flagg finishes as a top-25 fantasy option, Jalen Green averages 20 PPG
content: Eric Karabell forecasts what to expect from notable players such as Cooper Flagg, Jalen Green, Jonathan Kuminga and more.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Saudi league eyes Salah, Vin√≠cius Jr. plus 50 more
content: The Saudi Pro League has big plans to sign Liverpool's Mohamed Salah and Real Madrid's Vin√≠cius J√∫nior. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Rename Andaman & Nicobar As 'Azad Hind': K Kavitha Writes To PM Modi
content: Former MP and Telangana Jagruthi President K Kavitha said that she has written to Prime Minister Narendra Modi that the Andaman and Nicobar Islands be renamed as Azad Hind.

title: Murals Of Native, Migratory Birds Transform Forgotten Corners Of Hong Kong
content: A flock has landed in Wang Tong Village, a peaceful corner of Lantau Island on Hong Kong's southwestern edge. But this flock is unlike others: Its birds are made of paint.

title: BJP Insulting Icons, Distorting History: Mamata Banerjee's Big Attack
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has accused the BJP and the central government of insulting the national icons like Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose, Mahatma Gandhi, and BR Ambedkar.

title: Over 5,000 Killed In Iran's Crackdown On Nationwide Protests: Activists
content: The toll in Iran's bloody crackdown on nationwide protests has reached at least 5,002 people killed, activists said Friday, warning many more were feared dead

title: IndiGo Shares Decline Nearly 4% After Q3 Net Profit
content: Shares of InterGlobe Aviation, parent company of IndiGo, declined nearly 4 per cent on the bourses on Friday after the country's largest airline reported a 78 per cent decline in December quarter net profit at Rs 549.1 crore.

title: Pics: Republic Day Rehearsal Parade Held Amid Rain At Delhi's Kartavya Path
content: In preparations for the 77th Republic Day celebrations, a full dress rehearsal was held amid heavy rain at Katavya Path in New Delhi on Friday.

title: Video: Iron Rods, Stones Fly As Karnataka College Students Assault Juniors
content: Twenty-three students of a college in Karnataka have been named in a police complaint on charges of ragging, assault, vandalism and robbery.

title: Immigrants Don't Open Doors To Federal Agents. New Policy Could Change That
content: Over the decades, it has become common knowledge in immigrant communities across the country to not open the door for federal immigration officers unless they show a warrant signed by a judge.

title: Explained: Can Trump Purchase Greenland?
content: US President Donald Trump has said repeatedly that he wants to acquire Greenland, possibly by purchasing it from Denmark, despite the US ally's repeated insistence that it is not for sale.

title: "Free Trade Way Forward, Not Tariffs": German Envoy To NDTV On India-EU Trade Deal
content: Beyond trade, German envoy Dr Philipp Ackermann said India-EU summit would also deepen cooperation in security and defence, with a roadmap expected to be agreed upon.

title: The Rise Of Unqualified Doctors In Pakistan And Its Impact On Public Health
content: Rusted nails hold used infusion tubes on the wall of a clinic run by one among hundreds of thousands of unqualified doctors operating across Pakistan.

title: 700-km Yatra Launched To Save Aravalli Hills From Mining Doom
content: In a bold call to arms for one of India's most ancient geological treasures, environmentalists, community leaders, and affected residents launched the 'Aravalli Sanrakshan Yatra' - a 700-kilometer foot march to safeguard the Aravalli mountain range

title: Delhi High Court Renotifies Rani Kapur's Suit On RK Family Trust For January 28
content: The Delhi High Court on Friday renotified for January 28 the civil suit filed by Rani Kapur concerning the dissolution of the RK Family Trust, after commencing a brief hearing in the matter.

title: Trump's MAGA Movement Escalates Attacks On Progressive White Women
content: Progressive white women have been persistent punching bags of President Donald Trump's MAGA movement, but attacks targeting the demographic group have become particularly vicious in recent weeks.

title: Why Union Budget Of 1973 Is Called India's 'Black Budget'
content: India entered the 1973-74 financial year under heavy strain. The 1971 war with Pakistan had stretched government finances, especially defence spending.

title: Humanoid Robot At Visakhapatnam Railway Station For Passenger Safety
content: In a first-of-its-kind initiative in Indian Railways, Waltair Division of the East Coast Railway (ECoR) Zone has introduced a humanoid robot 'ASC Arjun' at Visakhapatnam railway station to enhance passenger safety, security and service delivery.

title: "India's Job To Teach Dignity Through Its Conduct": RSS Chief Mohan Bhagwat
content: Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh chief Mohan Bhagwat said that India should teach the world dignity through its actions, not just through speeches or books.

title: "Sabarimala Probe Modi Ki Guarantee": PM Says Change Inevitable In Kerala
content: Change is inevitable in Kerala, thundered Prime Minister Narendra Modi this morning at a rally in Thiruvananthapuram, in a big attack on the Left government in the state.

title: Basant Panchami Prayers Begin At Bhojshala-Kamal Maula Following Court Top Order
content: Basant Panchami prayers and celebrations commenced at the Bhojshala-Kamal Maula complex in Dhar, following a Supreme Court order allowing both Hindu and Muslim communities to perform their respective religious rituals at the site.

title: Winter storm fern puts 230 million Americans under weather alerts
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. With an unwavering commitment to accuracy, depth, and timeliness, we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers. Join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world. Read More

title: Midseason report card: Cooper Flagg 'better than advertised'
content: Cooper Flagg is the youngest player in NBA history to surpass 40 points in a game . he is expected to be the rare no. 1 pick who gets playoff experience right away . the mavs are 18-26 and in 12th place in the Western Conference .

title: 'Heated Rivalry' stars named torchbearers for Milan Cortina Olympics
content: MILAN -- The actors co-starring in the hit hockey romance TV series "Heated Rivalry" are set to be among the torchbearers carrying the Olympic flame on the way to the Opening Ceremony for the Milan Cortina Games. The organizing committee announced Thursday that Hudson Williams and Connor Storrie will take part in the torch relay. The Opening Ceremony is scheduled for Feb. 6. The series based on the "Game Changers" books has captivated viewers with the fictional story of a Canadian player and a Russian rival sustaining a decade-long secret relationship. The first season became the No. 1 series on HBO Max. Originally developed for the Canadian streaming service Crave, the show scored a distribution deal with HBO and has been renewed for a second season. It will broadcast in Italy beginning next month.

title: How to reach the UCL knockouts: Can Chelsea, Bar√ßa avoid the playoff round?
content: the knockout rounds of the 2025-26 UEFA champions league are fast approaching . the final matchweek of the league phase must be played, and the stakes could hardly be higher for some of the continent's biggest clubs . liverpool , barcelona , chelsea and manchester city also competing for top eight spots .

title: Reranking Freshman of the Year contenders
content: Darryn Peterson scored 26 points on 11-of-13 shooting in a nationally televised win over Baylor on friday . he has played in at least 50% of his team's games . the performance helped him qualify for our rankings .

title: 10 must-see WNBA games for the 2026 season
content: the WNBA released its 2026 regular-season schedule on friday . the league will tip off its 30th season on may 8 . at the top of the list is a new CBA . a moratorium on league business as negotiations continue .

title: MLB offseason grades: Rating fits for Gore in Texas, Peralta in NY
content: the 2025-26 offseason is officially here, and we have you covered with grades and analysis for every major signing and trade this winter . if it's a big-money free agent signing that changes the course of your team's future, check back in for the freshest analysis through spring training .

title: Barnwell sorts out the wide receiver market: 20 free agents, trade targets and cut candidates
content: the 49ers are competing for a trip to the super bowl this weekend in the NFC Championship Game . the two most productive wideouts in football are the Rams ' Puka Nacua and the Seahawks' Jaxon Smith-Njigba .

title: The Hall of Fame has a starting pitcher problem. Here's what it means for today's aces
content: CC Sabathia is the only starting pitcher voted into the Hall of Fame this decade . the 2010s saw a spate of starters enshrined, a group composed largely of the last of the greats who were used in more or less traditional fashion .

title: Expert picks: 'The Highlight' is a bad matchup for 'The Baddy'
content: a matchup between lightweight fan favorites will headline the first fight card since Dec. 13 . paddy Pimblett, ESPN's no. 7-ranked lightweight, is undefeated in the UFC . his last win was a third-round knockout of Michael Chandler .

title: Major fire breaks out at godown in Dindigul
content: Fire and Rescue Services personnel rushed to the spot and began firefighting operations, but due to the highly inflammable nature of plastic materials, the flames could not be brought under control immediately

content: Police said close to a dozen schools received the emails during the morning hours, triggering precautionary closures and evacuation of students

content: Shrimp farmers are apprehensive about unknown pathogens in the broodstock in South East Asian countries

title: Heavy rain likely along north Tamil Nadu coast on January 24
content: Officials of the RMC said the wet weather conditions would last until January 26, bringing light to moderate rainfall to various parts of the State. Dry weather is expected to return over the State by January 27.

content: Transport Minister Ramalinga Reddy said he would first go through the judgment before responding to the order

content: It was only in January 2025 that the Karnataka Cabinet approved the declaration of Greater Hesaraghatta Grasslands Conservation Reserve (GHGCR), comprising 5,678 acres.

title: Sabarimala gold loss cases: Court grants former TDB officer Murari Babu statutory bail
content: Kollam Vigilance Court Judge Mohit C.S. granted bail to Babu as 90 days had elapsed since his arrest, and SIT had failed to file chargesheets in the two cases

title: The human cost behind every delivery
content: The Union government‚Äôs directive to quick-commerce platforms to drop the concept of 10-minute deliveries owing to the excessive stress it puts delivery personnel under has been welcomed by gig workers, but they say it is just the tip of the iceberg. Low pay, inadequate incentives, poor safety measures and mistreatment at work all threaten their livelihoods, writes Harish Gilai

title: 44 years on, closed dye factory‚Äôs contaminating colours still remain underground in Kochi
content: The unit produced Rhodamine-B, a fluorescent dye used mostly in textile, leather and cosmetics industries

title: Auroral activity captured at Hanle by IIA‚Äôs all-sky camera
content: This is the sixth time during the current solar cycle that the intense red coloured auroral activity was captured by the all-sky camera

title: The Ponzi playbook in Telangana: built on trust, broken by fraud
content: Promising high returns and low risk, Ponzi schemes are quietly draining household savings across Telangana and beyond. Behind polished apps, corporate facades and reassuring payouts lies a carefully engineered cycle of trust, timing and collapse.¬†Lavpreet Kaur¬†examines how such frauds flourish amid regulatory gaps

title: How¬†V.O. Chidambaram Pillai earned the title¬† ‚ÄòSekkizhutha¬†Chemmal‚Äô
content: VOC¬†was arrested on the charge of sedition on March 12, 1908.¬†A British jailer noticed his hands bleeding from the harsh labour of separating¬†coir¬†and spinning rope in the¬†Coimbatore¬†prison. Hence, he advised him to work at the oil press instead.¬†VOC¬† accepted the suggestion and pulled the oil press himself, a task normally reserved for bulls

title: When¬†E.V.K.¬†Sampath hit the headlines in Tamil Nadu
content: Sampath, nephew of¬†E.V.¬†Ramasamy, enjoyed a special relationship with¬†DMK¬†founder¬†C.N.¬†Annadurai.¬†Before other¬†DMK¬†leaders, he realised the futility of pursuing the demand for a¬†Dravida¬†Nadu. He quit the¬†DMK¬†in 1961 and founded a party, which he merged with the Congress. Sampath‚Äôs¬†birth centenary falls on March 6, 2026.
